reviews.title: Excellent location,
reviews.text: The hotel is very deserving of its high ratings. It is in an excellent position within easy walking distance of the Old Town and the central shops.

reviews.title: Great Value
reviews.text: The 98 bus from the airport stops at Albert 1 and from there it is about 5-7 minutes. The train station is only about 10 minutes.

reviews.title: Good central location
reviews.text: The welcome was friendly and the free internet is located in the lobby. There is a DVD rental machine there where for €2.50 per day you can rent an unlimited number of DVD's. As we had our 3 year old with us we brought some of his favourite region 2 DVD's.
The room was a good size and very clean. There is a program of bathrooms being upgraded, ours had yet to be done but was perfectly fine if a little tired.
reviews.title: Loved the red carpet

reviews.text: Breakfasts were very good and all the staff were welcoming.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.text: Stayed here for four nights,very clean, staff friendly and helpful, good sized double room with teamaker.Complimentary coffee in reception. I made a mistake with my booking,should have stayed five nights. The staff at reception were very helpful,and eventually found me alternative accomodation in a sister hotel 'boreal'a few streets away for my second night as they were fully booked. There was no comparison with the two hotels.The'Boreal' looked jaded and in need of a makeover,I was glad to return to 'Roosevelt'were they gave us our previous room for the remainder of the stay.Free internet access in lobby. Decent breakfast included in my deal,otherwise 9euro.Excellent location.
reviews.title: very helpful
Good all round, no complaints
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights in February 2006 during the carnival. The hotel is in a quiet, safe location, yet within walking distance of the Promenade, Old Town, Bus Station etc. The room was clean and tidy, with towels changed daily on request. There is a very good range for breakfast to help yourself to, and it is worth the 8 euro charge.

reviews.title: Excellent Value
reviews.text: There is a pedestrian area close by, with lots of good restaurants. We enjoyed a good meal at O Palermo staffed by a friendly italian family.

reviews.title: Excellent value & position
reviews.text: The Old Town is the most interesting part of Nice with good shopping and restaurants. The Nissa Socca is a small, welcoming restaurant serving local specialities.

Go to Monaco! There's so much to see and do there that we spent two days there. The Jardin Exotique is good, the changing of the guard at the palace is worth a visit and you have to see the casino. Public transport is excellent value - 2.60 euro for a return trip on the 100 bus to Monaco/Menton and the views are thrown in for free :)
reviews.title: You get for you paid
Brilliant Location
reviews.text: A good hotel in a GREAT LOCATION.

We arrived in the evening and the Hotel looked very inviting and special, especially with the red carpet along the pavement outside (the red carpet also covered the pavevments of the surrounding shops - a Christmas thing).
reviews.title: Great Stay in a Good Hotel

reviews.text: The reception area looked modern, smart and inviting. A good welcome from the receptionist who spoke good english (I was prepared to try but it does make it alot easier). The reception area had free coffee that you could help your self to, free internet access (which was very popular) and a machine that lets you hire DVDs from at 2.50 euros a day for as many as you want.
reviews.title: Gret location

reviews.text: We had a double room on the third floor which was just about the right size. I am glad it wasn't smaller but then we were only staying for a weekend. Very modern decor just as advertised. The bathroom was clean and tidy but would benefit from a revamp. No bath(which would have been nice after all that walking), just a shower with a shower curtain (they should be banned - especially as they stick to your legs). I did see some workman tiling a bathroom in one of the rooms so maybe revamping the bathrooms are on the agenda.
reviews.title: Excellent Family Hotel, Great Value for Money

reviews.text: They seem to like putting the heating on very high. We brits are used to the cold and when we turn it down the cleaning staff seem to whack it up again when we are out.
reviews.title: excellent value for money
Excellent Location
reviews.text: This represents good value for a three star hotel if all you want is a base from which to explore Nice as the location is very central to what you need. Staff are friendly.

Our room had been completely refurbished and looked "like new" with matching carpets wallcoverings, curtains bedspread and furniture. It was, however, a little small and had a "quirky" shower room which was tiny and smelt of the drains. The bed was a five inch mattress on an unsprung iron frame but was comfortable. The room had double windows that opened onto a tiny balcony overlooking the street. The air conditioning worked.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in a Nice City

reviews.text: Breakfast was fine but very busy on some mornings. As the tables are close together it was not a place to linger. We stayed seven nights and booked this on the strength of other reviews. We were not disappointed but please don't think that you would be getting a four star hotel at three star prices.
reviews.title: Good Location, Great Value in an Expensive City

reviews.text: Take the airport bus No 98 and get off at the Le Meridien Hotel. 10 min walk to the hotel. Easy to find.
